description.en: Learn to use 'must' for logical conclusions and deductions (90% certainty). CRITICAL: Use 'can't' (NOT 'mustn't') for negative deductions.
description.es: Aprende a usar 'must' para conclusiones lógicas y deducciones (90% de certeza). CRÍTICO: Usa 'can't' (NO 'mustn't') para deducciones negativas.

prompt.es: Paul llegó a la fiesta en helicóptero. Debe de estar forrado.

exercises.solution: Paul arrived at the party by helicopter. He must be loaded.

tip.en: Use 'must' for logical deduction when you're 90% certain based on evidence. Pattern: [evidence] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusion]
tip.es: Usa 'must' para deducción lógica cuando estás 90% seguro basado en evidencia. Patrón: [evidencia] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusión]

prompt.es: "No he comido en tres días." Debes de tener mucha hambre.

exercises.solution: "I haven't eaten for three days." You must be very hungry.

tip.en: Use 'must' for logical deduction when you're 90% certain based on evidence. Pattern: [evidence] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusion]
tip.es: Usa 'must' para deducción lógica cuando estás 90% seguro basado en evidencia. Patrón: [evidencia] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusión]

prompt.es: "No he dormido en 48 horas." Debes de tener mucho sueño.

exercises.solution: "I haven't slept for 48 hours." You must be very tired.

tip.en: Use 'must' for logical deduction when you're 90% certain based on evidence. Pattern: [evidence] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusion]
tip.es: Usa 'must' para deducción lógica cuando estás 90% seguro basado en evidencia. Patrón: [evidencia] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusión]

prompt.es: Ellos no cogen el teléfono de su casa. Deben de estar fuera.

exercises.solution: They aren't answering their phone at home. They must be out.

tip.en: Use 'must' for logical deduction when you're 90% certain based on evidence. Pattern: [evidence] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusion]
tip.es: Usa 'must' para deducción lógica cuando estás 90% seguro basado en evidencia. Patrón: [evidencia] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusión]

prompt.es: Ella va a misa todos los domingos. Debe de ser católica.

exercises.solution: She goes to mass every Sunday. She must be Catholic.

tip.en: Use 'must' for logical deduction when you're 90% certain based on evidence. Pattern: [evidence] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusion]
tip.es: Usa 'must' para deducción lógica cuando estás 90% seguro basado en evidencia. Patrón: [evidencia] + He/She/It/They must be + [conclusión]

prompt.es: Acabo de comer tres platos y digo "tengo hambre." ¡No puedes tener hambre!

exercises.solution: I've just eaten a three-course meal and say "I'm hungry." You can't be hungry!

tip.en: CRITICAL: For negative deductions, use 'can't' (NOT 'mustn't'). 'Mustn't' is only for prohibition, never for negative logical conclusions.
tip.es: CRÍTICO: Para deducciones negativas, usa 'can't' (NO 'mustn't'). 'Mustn't' es solo para prohibición, nunca para conclusiones lógicas negativas.

prompt.es: He dormido 16 horas seguidas y digo "Tengo sueño." ¡No puedes tener sueño!

exercises.solution: I've slept for 16 hours and say "I'm tired." You can't be tired!

tip.en: CRITICAL: For negative deductions, use 'can't' (NOT 'mustn't'). 'Mustn't' is only for prohibition, never for negative logical conclusions.
tip.es: CRÍTICO: Para deducciones negativas, usa 'can't' (NO 'mustn't'). 'Mustn't' es solo para prohibición, nunca para conclusiones lógicas negativas.

prompt.es: Hablo de mi primo que lleva 15 años trabajando como escritor inédito. No debe de ser muy bueno.

exercises.solution: I talk about my cousin who's worked as an unpublished writer for 15 years. He can't be very good!
